text.7: وَّهُمْ عَلٰى مَا يَفْعَلُوْنَ بِالْمُؤْمِنِيْنَ شُهُوْدٌ  ۗ
text.8: وَمَا نَقَمُوْا مِنْهُمْ اِلَّآ اَنْ يُّؤْمِنُوْا بِاللّٰهِ الْعَزِيْزِ الْحَمِيْدِۙ
text.9: الَّذِيْ لَهٗ مُلْكُ السَّمٰوٰتِ وَالْاَرْضِ ۗوَاللّٰهُ عَلٰى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ شَهِيْدٌ  ۗ
text.10: اِنَّ الَّذِيْنَ فَتَنُوا الْمُؤْمِنِيْنَ وَالْمُؤْمِنٰتِ ثُمَّ لَمْ يَتُوْبُوْا فَلَهُمْ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابُ الْحَرِيْقِۗ
text.11: اِنَّ الَّذِيْنَ اٰمَنُوْا وَعَمِلُوا الصّٰلِحٰتِ لَهُمْ جَنّٰتٌ تَجْرِيْ مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْاَنْهٰرُ ەۗ ذٰلِكَ الْفَوْزُ الْكَبِيْرُۗ

text.8: And they resented them only because they believed in Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Praiseworthy,

text.10: Indeed, those who persecute the believing men and believing women and then do not repent will have the punishment of Hell, and they will have the punishment of the Burning Fire.
text.11: Indeed, those who believe and do righteous deeds will have gardens beneath which rivers flow. That is the great attainment.
text.12: Indeed, the assault of your Lord is severe.

text.14: And He is the Forgiving, the Affectionate,
text.15: Possessor of the Throne, the Glorious,

text.1:
Dalam ayat ini, Allah bersumpah dengan langit yang mempunyai gugusan bintang-bintang yang luar biasa besarnya dan tak terhitung jumlah bintang di dalamnya. Sebagian sangat jauh jaraknya dari bumi sehingga cahayanya dalam perhitungan biasa baru sampai kepada kita setelah ribuan tahun lamanya, bahkan ada pula yang setelah miliaran tahun.

Allah bersumpah dengan gugusan bintang karena mempunyai keajaiban yang luar biasa dan mengandung hikmah yang besar dan banyak serta sangat berguna bagi manusia dalam kehidupannya.

Berbagai keajaiban dan hikmah itu menunjukkan kepada kita tentang kebesaran penciptanya yang Mahakuasa dan Mahatinggi ilmu-Nya serta Mahabijaksana.
text.2: Dalam ayat kedua, Allah bersumpah dengan hari yang dijanjikan-Nya, yaitu hari Kiamat, serta hari kepastian dan pembalasan. Ketika itu, hanya kekuasaan dan hukum Allah-lah yang berlaku.
text.3: Dalam ayat yang ketiga, Allah bersumpah dengan alam semesta ini yang dapat memalingkan perhatian. Ringkasnya, Allah bersumpah dengan alam semesta agar dapat memalingkan manusia memikirkan kebesaran dan keagungan-Nya, agar mereka dapat mengambil manfaat dari apa yang dapat mereka lihat itu dan agar mereka mencurahkan perhatiannya untuk dapat memperoleh hakikat dan rahasia alam yang masih tersembunyi.
text.4:
Dalam ayat-ayat ini diterangkan bahwa Allah telah membinasakan Najran, sebuah kota di Yaman, karena penduduknya telah menyiksa dan membunuh para pengikut Nabi Isa (orang-orang Nasrani) yang meninggalkan agama pembesar-pembesar negeri itu, yaitu agama Yahudi dan memeluk agama yang dibawa oleh Nabi Isa dengan memasukkan mereka ke dalam parit-parit yang telah mereka gali dan diberi api yang menyala-nyala. Orang-orang kafir negeri itu duduk di sekitar parit-parit itu menyaksikan siksaan yang tidak berperikemanusia-an itu.

Siksaan itu sebenarnya tidak patut mereka lakukan sebab orang-orang itu tidak mempunyai kesalahan yang besar. Mereka menyiksa hanya karena orang-orang mukmin itu beriman kepada Allah Yang Mahaperkasa lagi Maha Terpuji, yang mempunyai kerajaan langit dan bumi serta berkuasa atas semua yang ada pada keduanya. Sungguh tidak ada jalan bagi orang yang zalim itu untuk lari dari kekuasaan-Nya.

Bagi orang-orang mukmin siksaan dan pembunuhan ini hanyalah merupakan cobaan dan ujian yang akan membawa mereka kepada kebahagiaan abadi apabila mereka tetap sabar dengan tetap beriman kepada Allah.

text.9: Pada akhir ayat ini, Allah menerangkan bahwa Ia telah menyaksikan segala sesuatunya dan dengan demikian akan memberikan balasan yang setimpal atas kekejaman yang telah dilakukan oleh orang-orang kafir itu.
text.10: Dalam ayat ini, Allah menerangkan bahwa bagi orang-orang kafir yang menganiaya dan menyiksa orang-orang mukmin dan mereka tidak mau meninggalkan agamanya, tetap dalam kekufuran, tidak bertobat sebelum mereka meninggal, telah disediakan api neraka untuk mengazab mereka di akhirat nanti.
text.11: Dalam ayat ini, Allah menerangkan bahwa orang-orang yang beriman mengakui bahwa Tuhan Maha Esa. Oleh karena itu, mereka mengerjakan pekerjaan yang sesuai dengan perintah Allah dan menjauhkan diri dari semua larangan-Nya. Semua itu mereka lakukan untuk mengharapkan keridaan-Nya. Di akhirat Allah akan memberi mereka kebun-kebun yang mengalir di bawahnya anak sungai, sehingga mereka hidup bahagia abadi di dalam surga, sebagai ganjaran atas keimanan dan kepatuhan mereka.

Dalam ayat ini dijelaskan bahwa siksa yang akan ditimpakan kepada orang-orang kafir yang menganiaya, menyiksa, dan membunuh orang-orang mukmin karena tidak mau meninggalkan agama mereka, sangatlah keras. Perlu diingat bahwa Allah-lah yang telah menciptakan mereka, dan Dia pula yang menghidupkan mereka kembali.

Mereka akhirnya akan kembali kepada Allah. Apabila Ia belum menyiksa mereka di dunia ini, bukanlah berarti mereka tidak akan mendapat siksaan sama sekali. Akan tetapi, siksaan itu diundurkan waktunya sampai mereka kembali kepada-Nya, yaitu pada hari Kiamat.

Demikian pula dengan kaum Samud yang telah mendustakan Nabi Saleh sebagai utusan Allah. Mereka telah menyembelih unta yang menjadi tanda kenabiannya. Sebagai akibatnya, Allah menurunkan siksaan-Nya kepada mereka dengan menghancurkan negeri mereka serta memusnahkan semua yang ada.

en.name: The Constellations
en.source: Aplikasi Quran Kementrian Agama Republik Indonesia

text.1:
In this verse, Allah swears by the sky which possesses constellations of extraordinarily large sizes and countless stars within it. Some are so far away from Earth that their light, by ordinary calculations, only reaches us after thousands of years, and some even after billions of years.

Allah swears by the constellations because they possess extraordinary wonders and contain great and numerous wisdoms, and are very useful for humans in their lives.

These various wonders and wisdoms show us the greatness of their Creator, who is the All-Powerful, the Most Exalted in Knowledge, and the All-Wise.
text.2: In the second verse, Allah swears by the promised Day, which is the Day of Judgment, as well as the day of certainty and retribution. At that time, only the power and law of Allah will prevail.
text.3: In the third verse, Allah swears by this universe which can divert attention. In short, Allah swears by the universe so that it can turn people to think about His greatness and majesty, so that they can benefit from what they can see, and so that they devote their attention to obtaining the essence and secrets of nature that are still hidden.
text.4:
In these verses, it is explained that Allah destroyed Najran, a city in Yemen, because its inhabitants tortured and killed the followers of Prophet Isa (Christians) who abandoned the religion of the nobles of that land, namely Judaism, and embraced the religion brought by Prophet Isa by throwing them into ditches they had dug and filled with blazing fire. The disbelievers of that land sat around the ditches, witnessing that inhumane torture.

That torture was actually undeserved because those people had not committed a great sin. They tortured them only because those believers believed in Allah, the Almighty, the Praiseworthy, who possesses the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and has power over all that exists in both. Indeed, there is no way for the unjust to escape from His power.

For the believers, this torture and killing are only trials and tests that will lead them to eternal happiness if they remain patient while remaining faithful to Allah.

text.8:
In these verses, it is explained that Allah destroyed Najran, a city in Yemen, because its inhabitants tortured and killed the followers of Prophet Isa (Christians) who abandoned the religion of the nobles of that land, namely Judaism, and embraced the religion brought by Prophet Isa by throwing them into ditches they had dug and filled with blazing fire. The disbelievers of that land sat around the ditches witnessing that inhumane torture.

That torture was actually undeserved because those people had not committed any great sin. They tortured them only because those believers believed in Allah, the All-Mighty, the Praiseworthy, who possesses the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and has power over all that exists in both. Indeed, there is no way for the unjust to escape from His power.

For the believers, this torture and killing is only a trial and test that will lead them to eternal happiness if they remain patient while remaining faithful to Allah.
text.9: At the end of this verse, Allah explains that He has witnessed everything and will therefore give a fitting recompense for the cruelty that has been committed by those who disbelieve.
text.10: In this verse, Allah explains that for the disbelievers who persecute and torture the believers and they do not want to abandon their religion, remaining in disbelief, not repenting before they die, a fire of Hell has been prepared to punish them in the Hereafter.
text.11: In this verse, Allah explains that those who believe acknowledge that God is One. Therefore, they perform deeds in accordance with Allah's commands and abstain from all His prohibitions. They do all of this hoping for His pleasure (rida). In the Hereafter, Allah will grant them gardens beneath which rivers flow, so that they may live in eternal happiness in Paradise, as a reward for their faith and obedience.
text.12:
This verse explains that the punishment that will be inflicted upon the disbelievers who oppress, torture, and kill the believers because they refuse to abandon their religion is very severe. It must be remembered that Allah is the One who created them, and He is also the One who will resurrect them.

They will ultimately return to Allah. If He has not punished them in this world, it does not mean that they will not receive any punishment at all. Rather, the punishment is postponed until they return to Him, which is on the Day of Judgment.

text.14: This verse explains that Allah is the Most Forgiving for those who return to Him in repentance, the Most Merciful for those who sincerely and earnestly love Him. Allah also possesses power that must prevail, His command cannot be refuted, and He does what He wills. If Allah wills destruction for those who disbelieve and are disobedient, no power can prevent Him.

text.17:
In these verses, Allah explains in the form of a question to the Prophet Muhammad whether the story of Pharaoh and his people, who denied the prophethood of Prophet Musa, the story of Pharaoh's arrogance, and the disbelief of his people, as well as the consequences of their actions, which was being drowned in the sea, has reached him.

Similarly, with the people of Thamud who denied Prophet Saleh as a messenger of Allah. They slaughtered the camel that was a sign of his prophethood. As a result, Allah sent down His punishment upon them by destroying their land and annihilating everything in it.

In short, the disbelievers have not changed since ancient times. They always deny the truth of the religion brought by the prophets, the messengers of Allah. They will certainly receive their recompense as did the people before them, if they do not repent and return to the path that pleases Allah.

text.19:
In these verses, Allah explains in the form of a question to the Prophet Muhammad, has the story of Pharaoh and his people reached him, those who denied the prophethood of Prophet Musa, the story of Pharaoh's arrogance, and the disbelief of his people, as well as the consequences of their actions, which was being drowned in the sea.

Similarly, with the people of Thamud who denied Prophet Saleh as a messenger of Allah. They slaughtered the camel that was a sign of his prophethood. As a result, Allah sent down His punishment upon them by destroying their land and annihilating everything in it.

In short, the disbelievers have not changed since ancient times. They always deny the truth of the religion brought by the prophets, the messengers of Allah. They will certainly receive their recompense as did the people before them, if they do not repent and return to the path that pleases Allah.
text.20: In this verse, Allah explains that they will not escape from His power, and will not be able to flee from His reach.
text.21: In this verse, Allah explains that the Qur'an is a noble book of Allah, preserved in Lauh Mahfudh. Nothing can match its content and arrangement of words, protected from falsification and alteration. This is a response to the disbelievers who deny the Qur'an by saying that it is merely stories of ancient people.
